3.1.1.6.1.3. ce_expansion.utility.gen_gamma module¶

ce_expansion.utility.gen_gamma.calculate_gamma(element1: str, element2: str, exp: Filename for experimental data = '../data/experimental_hbe.csv', est: Filename for theoretical data = '../data/estimated_hbe.csv') → tuple[source]¶

Given a pair of elements: “element1” and “element2”, this function calculates the gamma coefficient from Yan et al.

Parameters

  • element1 (str) – The first element in the bimetallic pair

  • element2 (str) – The second element in the bimetallic pair

  • exp (str) – Experimental heterolytic bond dissociation energies. This is the preferred source of data.

  • est (str) – Theoretical heterolytic bond dissociation energies. If no experiment is available, we get our data from here.

Returns

The two gamma coefficients as two floats inside a tuple, in the order the two elements were provided. In other words, calling the function with element1 = “Cu” and element2 = “Ag” would return a tuple where the first entry is the gamma coefficient for Cu, and the second entry is the gamma coefficient for Ag.

ce_expansion.utility.gen_gamma.csv_to_dict(filename: str) → dict[source]¶

Given a filename, this file reads a table in CSV form that has labeled columns and rows, and returns a dictionary whose indices araasdfasdfasde named by those labels. Rows are given priority as the first index.

Parameters

filename (str) – A valid filename for a file.

Returns

A dictionary composed of the data in the CSV file
